conclusion: Plan to analyze the velocity-time graph of the motorcycle and the car's velocity equation to find the minimum safe distance.
The motorcycle starts at a velocity of 4 m/s and decelerates to 0 m/s over 8 seconds.
The car's velocity equation is \( v_2 = 3 - 0.25t \). Setting \( v_2 = 0 \) gives \( t = 12 \) seconds, so the car stops after 12 seconds.
The car is still moving when the motorcycle stops after 8 seconds.
The distance traveled by the motorcycle in 8 seconds is 32 meters.
The minimum safe distance is the distance traveled by the motorcycle plus the initial distance: 33.5 meters.
